div.p:
This Services Agreement is dated
(the “Effective Date”) by and between:

Fusion Outsourcing and Services LLC, a limited liability company incorporated under the laws of the State of Qatar, registered under commercial registration number 61781, having its registered address at 6th floor, Amara Building, Ibn Mahmoud Street, Bin Mahmoud Doha, Qatar, P.O. Box 14383 Doha, State of Qatar (hereinafter referred to as the “Service Provider” which term shall include its successors, and permitted assigns), represented by Mohamed Ismail , an Egyptian citizen, QID number 27681803858. and

, a company incorporated under the laws of
registered under commercial registration number
, having its registered address at
, , , , ,
P.O. Box number, (hereinafter referred to as the “Company” which term shall include its successors, and permitted assigns), represented by
, a
citizen, holder ID number

p.span: The Service Provider and the Company are referred to herein, collectively, as “Parties” and, individually, as a “Party”.

div.p: The Company wishes to engage the Service Provider to provide the Company with support personnel for the conduct of its activities in the State of Qatar, from time to time, as set forth herein.

The Service Provider has the relevant skills, employees, licenses and expertise required to provide the Services (hereinafter defined) required by the Company and has agreed to provide such Services to the Company in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

NOW, THEREFORE,
in consideration of the mutual covenants contained in this Agreement, the Parties agree as follows:
The following terms shall have the defined meanings set throughout this Agreement.
Additional Services means the provision of any additional services not included in the Services.
Agreement means this Services Agreement and all its schedules.
Allocated Services means the services to be carried out by the Personnel as specified in the written request addressed by the Company to the Service Provider.
Applicable Law means the laws of the State of Qatar.
Business Day means any day other than a Friday, Saturday or any other day which is a public holiday in the State of Qatar.
Calendar Day: means any day of the week, including weekends.

Claims means any and all costs, expenses (including without limitation reasonable attorneys’ fees, expenses, and court costs), liabilities, damages, claims, suits, actions and causes of actions whatsoever.
Commencement Date means the date agreed between the Parties on which the relevant Personnel shall start providing the Allocated Services to the Company as per the request of the Company.

Confidential Information includes all information that is or has been furnished to any receiving Party by or on behalf of such disclosing Party, and/or any of its affiliates; whether written or oral or in electronic or other form and whether prepared by the disclosing Party or otherwise, together with all written or electronically-stored documentation prepared or developed by such receiving Party based on, containing, or otherwise reflecting, in whole or in part, any of such information, including any notes, analyses, compilations, forecasts, studies, memoranda, trade secrets, ideas, concepts, formulas, software, operational information, products, processes, procedures, methods, applications, technologies, financial information, customer information, or other data.
Data means any and all data (including identified or identifiable Personnel data), information, text, drawings, plans, diagrams or images relating to a Party and/or the Personnel.
Employment Date means the date of the Personnel being employed by the Service Provider as per the attested E-Contract.
Fees means applicable fees for the Services as set out under Clause 3 and as further detailed in Schedule 2.

Force Majeure Event means any event or occurrence outside of the reasonable control of the Affected Party (hereinafter defined) that prevents, hinders or delays the Affected Party’s performance hereunder, including, to the extent the criteria laid out under Clause 5.4 of this Agreement are met and excluding changes in market conditions and/or the payment of money, any of the following: (a) war (whether or not declared), civil commotion or insurrection; (b) sabotage or acts of vandalism; (c) earthquake, tsunami, landslides, lightning strike or other natural disaster; (d) plague or epidemic; (e) ionizing radiation or radioactive contamination; (f) pressure waves caused by aircraft or other aerial devices or articles falling from aircraft; (g) international embargos or other import restrictions; and (h) shortage of personnel, materials or utilities directly resulting from an event or circumstance listed in this definition.
Indemnified Parties means a Party’s officers, officials, employees, agents, representatives, successors, and assigns.

Intellectual Property: means all patents, copyright, trademarks, service marks, registered designs (and all registrations, applications, disclosures, renewals, extensions, continuations, or reissues for any of the foregoing), unregistered design rights, trade and business names and other similar protected rights or intangible assets recognised by laws or international conventions in any country or jurisdictions in the world whether now known or which may exist in the future.
Invoice means the invoice issued by the Service provider to the Company for the rendering of the Services.
Labor Law means the State of Qatar’s law No. (14) of 2004, as amended.

Notice means any notice, consent, or other communication required or permitted under this Agreement, which must be in writing and either delivered in person, sent by electronic mail, facsimile transmission, registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, or deposited with any commercial air courier or express service.
Personnel means Service Provider’s employees to be seconded to the Client in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

Secondment Period means the period from the Commencement Date during which the Personnel shall carry out the Allocated Services. Unless agreed otherwise between the Parties, the expiry of the Secondment Period shall coincide with the expiry of the Term (or any extension thereof, as applicable).
Services means the services set out in Clause 2 and as further detailed under Schedule 1.
Taxes means all sales, use, personal property, or other taxes (including any penalties, fines or interest thereon), imposed by any government or taxing authority.
Term means the term of this Agreement as defined under Clause 5.

Unless the context requires otherwise: (i) words in this Agreement that appear in the singular, also apply to the plural, and vice versa; (ii) a reference to a gender applies to all genders; (iii) references to laws are taken to refer to amendments of those laws from time to time; (iv) a reference to a Party to this Agreement includes a reference to successors in title and permitted assigns; (v) headings to clauses in this Agreement are for ease of reference only and do not affect the interpretation of this Agreement and are not to be used to interpret the legal effect of this Agreement.

The Service Provider shall, upon being requested to do so in writing by the Company, provide the Company with suitably qualified and experienced Personnel to provide the Allocated Services throughout the Secondment Period as further described under Schedule 1 of this Agreement.

The CVs for the relevant Personnel proposed by the Service Provider shall be submitted to the Company for review. The Company shall be entitled, but not required, to conduct interviews with each Personnel. The Company shall thereafter consider the Personnel proposed by the Service Provider and shall inform the Service Provider of its decision as to whether it approves or rejects the proposed Personnel.
The Service Provider agrees that it shall make the relevant Personnel available to the Company from the agreed upon Commencement Date to provide the Allocated Services for the Secondment Period.

The Service Provider shall provide the Services: (i) in good faith; (ii) with the diligence, care and skill and in accordance with the market and industry standards applicable to a reasonably prudent service provider in comparable circumstances and in performing services similar to the Services; (iii) in accordance with Applicable Laws (including, without limitation, in compliance with any relevant license, authorizations, consents, permit to perform the Services); and (iv) in accordance with the terms of this Agreement).

In consideration for the Services rendered by the Service Provider to the Company, the Company shall pay the Service Provider the applicable fees as set out in this Clause 3 and as further detailed in Schedule 2 attached hereto (the “Fees Schedule”).

Unless agreed otherwise in writing by the Parties, in case Additional Services are required from the Company, the fees for such Additional Services will be calculated proportionally, in accordance with the fees for such Services as set forth in Schedule 2.

The Company shall, upon production of supporting documentation, reimburse the Service Provider for all costs and expenses incurred by the Service Provider in providing the Services as further set out under Schedule 2 and including without limitation the following (as applicable):

Personnel salaries and any additional compensation including without limitation, all allowances and benefits (including end of service entitlements and repatriation costs, annual leave, sick leave maternity leave and public holidays) mandated by Applicable Laws.
Health insurance.
Any relevant liability insurance.
Any other direct costs, charges or expenses paid by the Service Provider for the supply of the Personnel to the Company.
Mobilization and demobilization costs for the Personnel.
Altogether the Service Provider’s “Costs”.

The Company hereby agrees to pay relevant Personnel salaries (for the month following the invoice issued by the Service Provider regarding the same), as instructed by the Service Provider, and in any event no later than on the fifteenth (15 th ) day of a given month to the bank account designated by the Service Provider so as to allow Service Provider to comply with its obligations under the Wage Protection System (“WPS”).

The Company shall, upon execution of this Agreement, pay to the Service Provider a security deposit in the amount specified under Schedule 2(the “Security Deposit”) and in accordance with the following terms:
The Security Deposit shall be retained by the Service Provider during the Term of this Agreement.

In the event where the Company should breach or be in default with respect to any payment obligation (in particular the payment of Personnel salaries pursuant to Clause 3.2.2) or other covenant or condition of this Agreement, Service Provider may apply all or any part of the Security Deposit to the payment of any sum in default or any damage suffered by Service Provider as a result of such breach or default, and, in such event, the Company shall, upon demand by Service Provider, deposit with Service Provider the amount so applied so that Service Provider shall have the full Security Deposit on account at all times during the Term.

Service Provider 's use or application of all or any portion of the Security Deposit shall not prejudice any other rights or remedies provided under this Agreement or under Applicable Law and shall not be construed as a payment of liquidated damages.

The Company must confirm to the Service Provider by the 22nd month of each Personnel’s Employment Date whether such Personnel will carry on their employment further than 2 years as it is required that the Company shall pay an additional one-month Security Deposit to offset the second month of employment termination notice period of such Personnel in accordance with Qatar laws and regulations. The Service Provider shall raise an invoice for the additional month Security Deposit in advance of the 23rd month of the Employment Date.

Absent any breach or default of the Company, the Security Deposit shall be refunded to the Company at the expiry of the Term, without interest, within thirty (30) Business Days after the expiration of this Agreement.
Save as otherwise provided in this Agreement, the Service Provider shall provide the Company with a monthly invoice, in arrears, setting out applicable Fees for the Services rendered.
The invoice shall be due in full, without any deduction or set-off, at the time of receipt of the invoice by the Company.

Save as otherwise provided in this Agreement, the Company agrees to pay the invoice as soon as possible upon receipt of the same and in any event no later than
following receipt of the same.
Unless agreed otherwise by the Parties in writing, payments shall be made by wire transfer, in per cent (), to the bank account designated by the Service Provider to the Company.

A late payment penalty of
(%) of any outstanding amount shall apply to any invoice(s) remaining unpaid after
of such invoice’s due date.
Notwithstanding the above, the Company acknowledges and agrees that applicable government fees (“Government Fees”) will have to be paid in advance of any Personnel request by the Company.
In addition to any other obligations set out in this Agreement, the Service Provider shall be responsible for the following:

Making all the necessary arrangements to enable the Personnel to enter, reside and carry out the Allocated Services in Qatar, including securing the Personnel's entry visa, residence permit, work visa and exit permits, together with any renewals that may occur during the Secondment Period.

Carrying out adapted background checks on the Personnel to ensure that such Personnel are fit for purposes of carrying out the Allocated Service (i.e. no criminal records or pending charges for crimes of violence, fraud or dishonesty);
Ensuring that the Personnel is registered with the Qatar authorities for purposes of compliance with the WPS.

Upon Company’s written request, issuing relevant no-objection certificates (“ NOC”) for the following purposes only: (i) driver’s license application, (ii) family visa application, (iii) liquor license application, (iv) bank account opening application.

Keeping and making available to the Company and its designees for inspection and audit, accurate and complete records supporting Fees, Costs, Government Fees, and any other expenses paid or to be paid in furtherance of this Agreement.
Paying applicable Fees, Government Fees and reimbursing Service Provider for its Costs as reflected in the invoices to be issued by Service Provider to the Company.
Paying the Security Deposit.

Taking such steps as may be necessary to assist Service Provider with complying with its obligations under the Personnel' s contracts of employment with Service Provider; provided such steps are not inconsistent with Applicable Law.

Reasonably cooperating with Service Provider in any steps Service Provider may take under its grievance or disciplinary procedures in relation to the Personnel, provided such steps are not inconsistent with Applicable Law.
Notifying Service Provider promptly of any grievances, complaints or issues in relation to the Personnel.
Providing adapted facilities on the Company’s premises or designated employment site for the Personnel to carry out the Allocated Services safely and effectively.

Provide suitable accommodation, transportation and food to the employees as listed in Schedule 2 as per the minimum standards outlined in Qatar Foundation Mandatory Standards of Migrant Worker’s Welfare for Contractors and Sub-contractors and Qatar Labour Law. The Company shall notify/keep up to date the Service Provider with the location of such accommodation as well as the related information in a timely manner upon request and/or any changes to the aforementioned.
Provide to the Service Provider a timesheet on a monthly basis identifying the number of;
a.
Working Days
b.
Annual Leave Days
c.
Unpaid Leave Days
d.
Maternity Leave Days
e.
Other Days, as may be appropriate, on a case-by-case basis.
That the Personnel have taken, signed and acknowledged by the Personnel and the Company.

Unless earlier terminated pursuant to Clause 5.2 below, the term of this Agreement shall start on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of
Months.
This Agreement shall be automatically renewed, unless termination notice being served by either Party as per Clause 5.2 below
This Agreement shall terminate with immediate effect upon the occurrence of any of the following:
upon the mutual and written agreement of the Parties.

upon the Company serving a [thirty (30) days] prior Notice of its intent to terminate the Agreement, at the Company’s sole discretion and without any penalty or termination fee; following service of such notice, the Service Provider will make the necessary arrangements for the termination of the relevant Personnel (including without limitation issuing termination letters and calculating end of service benefits) and/or for their transfer to another employer (as applicable);

upon the Service Provider serving a [forty five (45) days] prior Notice of its intent to terminate the Agreement, at the Company’s sole discretion and without any penalty or termination fee; following service of such Notice, the Service Provider shall make the necessary arrangements for the termination of the Personnel (including without limitation issuing termination letters and calculating end of service benefits) and/or, upon request of the Company and/or the Personnel followed by the Company’s approval, arrange, in its sole discretion, for the issuance of NOCs to such Personnel to allow them to transfer their residence/work permits to the Company or another employer of their choosing.
in the event a Party breaches any material provision of this Agreement and such breach is not cured within twenty (20) days after Notice thereof is given by the other Party; or
if an Event of Force Majeure persists for more than thirty (30) Business Days.

To the extent permitted by applicable Law, either Party may give notice of termination, effective immediately if and when (a) the other Party becomes insolvent or admits its inability to pay its debts generally as they come due, (b) a case is filed against the other Party under any applicable insolvency law and such case continues undismissed for ninety (90) days; or (c) the other Party is dissolved or liquidated or takes any corporate action for such purpose.

Termination of this Agreement or part thereof, in accordance with its terms, shall be without prejudice to any other rights accruing to the Parties pursuant to this Agreement or by law and shall not prejudice any Claim, right or remedy that the terminating Party may have, including without limitation, claims for damages.

Both Parties shall return or destroy all documentation, information or materials belonging to the other Party as may have been obtained from or provided by the other Party during the course of this Agreement.

The Parties agree that undisputed payments for the Services delivered by the Service Provider to the Company up to the effective date of termination shall be payable to the Service Provider when due and before the settlement of any disputes between the Parties. If either Party has a dispute relating to any payment for the Services, such disputed payment will be payable upon the settlement of the aforementioned dispute.
The Company shall be liable to pay all relevant termination and/or transfer Costs referenced under Clause 5.2.1 (a), (b) and (c).

Clauses 6 [Representations and Warranties], 7 [Indemnification and Insurance], 11.2 [Confidentiality], 11.3 [Data Protection], 11.11 [Public Announcements], 12.3 [intellectual Property] and 12.14 [Applicable Law and Jurisdiction], shall survive the termination of this Agreement and shall be deemed to be included in a separate and independent document in full force and effect between the Parties.

Neither Party shall be responsible for failure or delay in performing its obligations hereunder to the extent such failure or delay is caused by a Force Majeure Event; provided that a Force Majeure Event shall not relieve a Party from liability for an obligation which arose before the occurrence of such Force Majeure Event, nor shall a Force Majeure Event affect the obligation of a Party to pay money in a timely manner which matured prior to the occurrence of such Force Majeure Event.

If either Party is or is likely to be prevented from or delayed in performing its obligations under this Agreement by a Force Majeure Event (the “Affected Party”), the Affected Party shall provide notice to the other Party as soon as practicable.

Each Party conclusively waives any right to claim relief under applicable Laws due to the occurrence of a Force Majeure Event which prevents, hinders or delays performance of any term or condition of this Agreement.
A Party affected by a Force Majeure Event shall use all reasonable efforts to mitigate the effect of such Event of Force Majeure.

For the avoidance of doubt, a Force Majeure Event does not include, and the Affected Party will not be entitled to relief on the grounds of a Force Majeure Event in respect of: (a) changes in market conditions; and (b) inability to make payment of money, other than as to any specified means, currency or place of payment.
REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES
The Service Provider hereby represents and warrants, and at all times during the Term shall be deemed to represent and warrant, to the Company that:
it has the legal capacity to enter into this Agreement and be bound in all respects by the terms herein.

no consents, permits or approvals, corporate or from any government authority (other than those required and obtained prior to the date of execution of this Agreement) are required as a condition precedent to its execution of this Agreement or to the performance of its obligations hereunder.

it holds all licenses, consents, permissions and authorizations required to enable the Service Provider to perform the Services as contemplated in this Agreement; and the Service provider shall provide the Company with all relevant up-to-date copies of such licenses, permits, consents, permissions, authorizations, as applicable, upon execution of this Agreement.

it is not in breach, and neither the execution and delivery of this Agreement nor the performance of its obligations under this Agreement shall result in the breach, of any provision or any law or regulation applicable to it or of any agreement, instrument, decree, order or judgment to which it is a party or by which its assets are bound, or constitute a default thereunder.

it is not (and is not deemed by law or a court to be) insolvent or bankrupt or unable to pay its debts as they fall due and has not stopped, suspended or threatened to stop or suspend payment of all or a material part of (or of a particular type of) its debts, has not proposed or made a general assignment or an arrangement or composition with, or for the benefit of, its creditors in respect of any of such debts and no moratorium has been agreed or declared in respect of, or affecting, all or any material part of (or of a particular type of) its debts;
it is not involved in any arbitration or litigation proceedings that may impact its business and/or the reputation and/or brand of the Company or its direct or indirect shareholders.
it is in good financial standing and is able to perform the obligations and responsibilities incumbent on him in this Agreement.
the Company hereby represents and warrants to the Service Provider that:
it has the legal capacity to enter into this Agreement and be bound in all respects by the terms herein.

no consents, permits or approvals, corporate or from any government authority (other than those required and obtained prior to the date of execution of this Agreement) are required as a condition precedent to its execution of this Agreement or to the performance of its obligations hereunder.

it is not in breach, and neither the execution and delivery of this Agreement nor the performance of its obligations under this Agreement shall result in the breach, of any provision or any law or regulation applicable to it or of any agreement, instrument, decree,
order or judgment to which it is a party or by which its assets are bound, or constitute a default thereunder; and

it is not (and is not deemed by law or a court to be) insolvent or bankrupt or unable to pay its debts as they fall due and has not stopped, suspended or threatened to stop or suspend payment of all or a material part of (or of a particular type of) its debts, has not proposed or made a general assignment or an arrangement or composition with, or for the benefit of, its creditors in respect of any of such debts and no moratorium has been agreed or declared in respect of, or affecting, all or any material part of (or of a particular type of) its debts.
All matters relating to any grievances raised by the Personnel remain the exclusive responsibility of the Service Provider.

If the Company becomes aware of any issues of deficient performance by the Personnel, it is to report them in writing to the Service Provider as soon as practicable, with reasonable details. The Service Provider shall consider and respond to the Company’s complaint with the Company within
() Business Days of receiving the complaint.

All matters relating to the discipline of the Personnel shall remain the exclusive responsibility of the Service Provider and shall be dealt with in accordance with the Service Provider's disciplinary procedure.

If the Company raises any disciplinary matter relating to the Personnel with the Service Provider, the Service Provider shall deal with the matter promptly. Any action to be taken shall remain wholly within the Service Provider's discretion and the Service Provider may in its discretion act in co-ordination with the Company in this respect.

The Service Provider shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the Company Indemnified Parties from and against any and all Claims with respect to: (a) any actual loss, damage to or destruction of real property, tangible property, and illness, injury or death to any person, arising out of the Service Provider’s negligent acts or omissions or willful misconduct; (b) any violation of Law; (c) any misrepresentation by the Service Provider; (d) any breach of the terms of this Agreement that is not cured in accordance with the provisions set forth herein.

The Company shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless the Service Provider Indemnified Parties from and against any and all Claims with respect to: (a) any actual loss, damage to or destruction of real property, tangible property, and illness, injury or death to any person, arising out of the Company’s negligent acts or omissions or willful misconduct; (b) any violation of Applicable Law; (c) any misrepresentation by the Company; (d) any breach of the terms of this Agreement that is not cured in accordance with the provisions set forth herein.

Without prejudice to the Parties’ liability to indemnify each other under this Agreement, the Parties shall, at all times and throughout the Term of this Agreement, secure and maintain such insurance policies as are necessary to cover any liabilities which they may respectively incur under this Agreement or as a result of its performance, including, without limitation, adequate coverage for loss or damage to life and/or property and any other insurance that may be required by Applicable Law.
The relevant insurance policies shall be obtained through a reputable insurance company licensed in Qatar and shall name the Parties as respective beneficiaries.
The Parties shall provide each other with all relevant up-to-date insurance certificate copies referred to herein upon execution of this Agreement.
Approval by either Party of any insurer or terms of insurance shall not limit nor relieve the other Party of any obligation or liability arising from this Agreement or at law.
EMPLOYMENT STATUS OF PERSONNEL

The Parties acknowledge that it is their intention that the Personnel should remain employed by the Service Provider throughout the Secondment Period provided, however, that during the relevant Secondment Period each Personnel shall:
on a day-to-day basis act in accordance with and subject to the reasonable and lawful instructions of the Company.
adhere to the Company's employment rules, regulations and policies (save for the grievance and disciplinary policies and procedures as per Clause 6 above); and

perform such duties and provide such services at such times and at such places as the Company may from time to time reasonably require, subject to Article 45 of the Labor Law. If the Company requires the Personnel to carry out tasks which are significantly outside the scope of the Personnel’s Allocated Services, the Company shall first obtain the Service Provider’s written authorisation before requiring the same.

During the Secondment Period, if there is any inconsistency between the Service Provider's and the Company's respective employment rules, regulations and policies, the Company's employment rules, regulations and policies shall prevail, save for the grievance and disciplinary policies and procedures as set out in Clause 6 of this Agreement; provided, however, that nothing herein shall be construed so as to relieve the Service Provider of its obligations under this Agreement and its obligations under its contracts of employment with the Personnel.

The Parties agree that the Company has absolute discretion with respect to incorporating the Personnel into the organizational structure of the Company. Personnel who are not included in the organizational structure of the Company may be referred to by the Company as consultants.

The Personnel are independent contractors in relation to the Company. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to create the relationship of employer and employee, principal and agent, distributor, partnership or joint venture, or any other fiduciary relationship between the Personnel and the Company.

p.b: TRANSFER OF PERSONNEL’S EMPLOYMENT TO THE COMPANY

div.p: At the expiry of [one (1) year] following the Commencement Date, the Company may request, in its sole discretion, for the Service Provider to organize the transfer of selected Personnel’s residence/work permit from the Service Provider to the Company.
It is expressly agreed that any relevant fees and Government Fees applicable to implement a transfer of Personnel pursuant to Clause 10.21 shall be borne by the Company.
Each Party shall be responsible for and shall duly pay any taxes levied against it in Qatar or other applicable jurisdictions.

Except as otherwise agreed between the Parties, a Party may not assign, transfer, charge or deal in any other manner with this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations under it, nor purport to do any of the same, nor sub-contract any or all of its obligations under this Agreement without having obtained the prior written consent of the other Party (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed).

Each Party shall hold in the strictest confidence and not disclose any Confidential Information to any person except if (a) disclosure is required by Law; or (b) the information is or has become public knowledge other than as a result of the unauthorized disclosure of the information by either Party.

If either Party is required under Clause 12.2.1 to disclose any Confidential Information to a third party, such disclosing party shall notify the other party and give the other party a reasonable opportunity to take any steps that the other party considers necessary to protect the confidentiality of that information.
Clause 12.2 shall survive the termination of this Agreement or the expiry of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever for a period of [two (2) years].

Each of the Parties shall at all times comply with its respective obligations pursuant to any and all applicable data protection regulations and legislation in relation to all Data that is processed by it in connection with this Agreement.

The Service Provider shall not process any Company Data in relation to its performance of the Services for any purposes other than those authorised by the Company and the Service Provider shall comply with all reasonable instructions consistent with this Agreement given by the Company, from time to time, in relation to such processing.

The Company shall not process any Personnel Data as a result of this Agreement for any purposes other than those authorised by the Service Provider and/or the Personnel (as applicable) and the Company shall comply with all reasonable instructions consistent with this Agreement given by the Service Provider, from time to time, in relation to such processing.
Each of the Service Provider and the Company agree that, at all times when processing Company Data, Service Provider Data and/or Personnel Data pursuant to this Agreement, it shall:

use its reasonable endeavors to implement appropriate technical and organizational security measures governing the processing of the Data to be carried out having regard to the nature of the the Data to be protected.
take reasonable steps to ensure the reliability of any of its employees who will have access to the Data.

promptly inform the owner of the Data if it becomes aware of any accidental or unlawful destruction or accidental loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of or access to such Data (each a "Data Breach") and shall provide the owner of the Data with reasonable assistance, at the relevant Party’s cost, in investigating and mitigating the impact of any such Data Breach.
The Parties agree to honour all existing and future rights for Intellectual Property, inventions and innovations belonging to the respective Parties.

Intellectual Property rights for items and brands separately developed by the Company during its on-going operations, research, and business growth, which do not rely on or derive from technology licensed to the Company by the Service Provider and/or the Personnel and/or a third party shall belong to the Company.

Intellectual Property rights for items and brands separately developed by the Service Provider during its on-going operations, research and business growth, which do not rely on or derive from technology licensed to the Service Provider by the Company and/or the Personnel and/or a third party shall belong to the Service Provider.

Unless agreed otherwise between the Parties and/or between the Company and the Personnel, Intellectual Property rights for items and brands developed by the Personnel for purposes of performing the Allocated Services, shall, to the extent permissible under Applicable Law, belong to the Company.

Any notices, consents, demands, requests, approvals and other communications to be given under this Agreement by any Party to another shall be deemed to have been duly given if given in writing and personally delivered or sent by recognized courier firms (DHL, Fedex or UPS) with return receipt requested, as follows:
If to Service Provider:
6 th Floor Amara Building,
Ibn Mahmoud Street, Bin Mahmoud Doha
Doha, Qatar
P.O Box 14383
Attention: Mohamed Ismail
Email: info@fusiongroupholding.com
Facsimile: +974 4012 0322
If to Company:

Notices delivered personally shall be deemed communicated as of actual receipt; mailed notices shall be deemed communicated as from the date of the return receipt provided by the courier firm. Any Party may change its, his or her address by written notice given to the other Parties in the manner set forth herein.

Should any clause, paragraph, sentence, or clause of this Agreement be determined to be void, illegal, or otherwise unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions of the Agreement shall not be rendered void and unenforceable as a result but rather shall remain in full force and effect.

No failure or delay on the part of any Party in the exercise of any right hereunder shall operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any such right preclude any other or further exercise thereof or of any other right. All rights and remedies under this Agreement are cumulative to, and not exclusive of, any rights or remedies otherwise available.

The Service Provider is an independent contractor; nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed to create the relationship of employer and employee, principal and agent, distributor, partnership or joint venture, or any other fiduciary relationship between the Service Provider and the Company.

The Parties agree that they have entered into this Agreement on a non-exclusive basis. The Parties shall be free to enter into transactions with third parties, which are similar to the transactions contemplated under this Agreement, without having to secure the prior approval of the other Party.

The Agreement constitutes the entire agreement and understanding between the Parties hereto and supersedes any and all prior agreements and understandings, oral or written, relating to the subject matter hereof.

This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts and by the Parties on separate counterparts, each of which when executed and delivered shall be an original but together constitute the entire Agreement.

Except to the extent otherwise required by Applicable Law or with the prior written consent of the other Party, neither Party shall make any public statement or announcement regarding this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereunder.

The Parties to this Agreement shall, after as well as before the execution of this Agreement, do all acts and things and sign and execute all documents requisite for the purpose of implementing and giving valid effect to the terms of this Agreement and the full benefit thereto.
In the event of any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement (a “Dispute”) the Parties shall first attempt to resolve such Dispute amicably.

In the event where a Dispute is not resolved within fifteen (15) Business Days of one Party’s written notice of such Dispute to the other Party, then such Dispute shall be escalated the Parties’ respective Chief Executive Officers (or equivalent) who shall have an additional period of fifteen (15) Business Days to resolve the Dispute.

In the event where the Dispute cannot b resolve in accordance with the provisions of Clause 12.13.1 and 12.13.2, the Dispute shall be referred to and finally resolved by arbitration under the Rules of the International Chamber of Commerce (the “Rules”), which Rules are deemed to be incorporated by reference into this clause.
It is agreed that:
The number of arbitrators shall be one (1).
The seat, or legal place, of arbitration shall be the city of Doha, Qatar.
The language to be used in the arbitration shall be English.
The governing law of the contract shall be the substantive law of Qatar.
Any meetings, hearings or other proceedings shall be held in Doha, Qatar, unless otherwise agreed between the Parties.

The Parties agree that the appointed arbitrator shall assign responsibility for the costs and fees for the arbitration, including administrative costs and fees and legal, witness and expert costs and fees, in light of its determination on the merits and taking into consideration the conduct of the arbitration proceedings, including the conduct of the Parties.
IN WITNESS WHEREOF the Parties have caused this Agreement to be executed by their respective duly authorized representatives on the date written above:
(STAMP)
(STAMP)

p.b: *The Service Provider expressly agrees and acknowledges that in the event that any monthly end of service gratuity (EOS) is not remitted to the Employees in the above table, upon termination of their employment as per Qatar Labour Law, the Service Provider will be required to return the EOS payments (processed by the Client as part of the Service Fee under this Agreement) to the Client within 45 days of the termination of the applicable employee’s employment.

div.p: In accordance with Clause 3.2.3 and it’s sub-clause (d): Prior to the onboarding of the Personnel, the Company will be required to place a Security Deposit of one Month’s Total Salary Package being QAR.

An annual Medical Insurance Policy shall be provided to each Personnel by the Service Provider, up to a value of QAR.
or otherwise as specified by the Company. The Service Provider shall invoice for such service as per payments terms hereof of this Agreement.
